intro: Chaetocalyx tenuipedicellatus, commonly known as the slender-fruited hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture and produces small, dry fruits known as capsules. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
